task_summary: Perceive the fridge door, approach and align to the handle, grasp it, pull to open the hinged door, then retreat and stabilize.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 robot opens a standard hinged refrigerator door. The robot first perceives the fridge door panel and handle region, then moves to a pre-grasp pose and aligns the end-effector. After preparing the gripper, it grasps the handle, rotates its wrist to a pulling-friendly yaw, and executes the door-opening action. Once the door swings open, the robot retreats slightly to avoid collision with the opening door and pauses briefly. The scene shows a white fridge beside drawers; interior shelves become visible as the door opens.
preconditions: Fridge door initially closed and reachable
Path to handle is free of obstacles
stepwise_plan: Detect the fridge door and verify visibility.
Move to pregrasp near the handle and open the gripper.
Align precisely to the handle and close the gripper.
Rotate wrist to 90Â° yaw and open the hinged door.
Retreat a short distance and wait to stabilize.
success_criteria: Fridge interior becomes visible (door clearly open).
No collision with door or surroundings.
Robot safely retracted from the open door area.
failure_and_recovery: Detection fails: rescan and adjust viewpoint.
Misalignment: reopen gripper, realign, and retry grasp.
Handle slip: increase grip force within safe bounds and retry.
Door stuck: repeat opening with adjusted approach or wrist yaw.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the door is open and the robot has retreated and stabilized.
